sense.gloss: proper use, using (different things) for different purposes

sdata.j: これらの↑単語↑↓たんご↓の↑使↑↓|つか↓い↑分↑↓わ↓け|↑方↑↓かた↓を↑教↑↓おし↓えて↑下↑↓くだ↓さい。
sdata.e: Could you teach me how people distinguish between these words in common usage?

sdata.j: ↑引用↑↓いんよう↓した↑問題↑↓もんだい↓ではありませんが、↑関係↑↓かんけい↓↑代名詞↑↓だいめいし↓と↑関係↑↓かんけい↓↑副詞↑↓ふくし↓の↑使↑↓|つか↓い↑分↑↓わ↓け|を↑問↑↓と↓う↑問題↑↓もんだい↓がリーディングセクションにはあります。
sdata.e: The problem quoted isn't one, but there are problems in the reading section that ask you to distinguish relative pronouns from relative adverbs.

sdata.j: アメリカも↑本音↑↓ほんね↓と↑建前↑↓たてまえ↓を↑使↑↓|つか↓い↑分↑↓わ↓け|る↑国↑↓くに↓だ。
sdata.e: America is also a country that separates its public motives from its private ones.

sdata.j: アメリカも↑本音↑↓ほんね↓と↑建前↑↓たてまえ↓を↑使↑↓|つか↓い↑分↑↓わ↓け|る↑国↑↓くに↓だ。
sdata.e: America is also a country that separates its public face from its private one.

sdata.j: アメリカも↑本音↑↓ほんね↓と↑建前↑↓たてまえ↓を↑使↑↓|つか↓い↑分↑↓わ↓け|る↑国↑↓くに↓だ。
sdata.e: America is also a country that separates what one says and does in public from what one says and does behind closed doors.

sdata.j: アメリカも↑本音↑↓ほんね↓と↑建前↑↓たてまえ↓を↑使↑↓|つか↓い↑分↑↓わ↓け|る↑国↑↓くに↓だ。
sdata.e: America is also a country that separates public actions and statements from private ones.
